{"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01KhTvkafuyq2vPRosjBia6g","type":"tool_result","content":"     1//! Orphans command for beads_zig.\n     2//!\n     3//! `bz orphans` - Find issues with missing parent references\n     4//!\n     5//! Detects orphaned issues in two ways:\n     6//! 1. Hierarchical orphans: Child issues (e.g., bd-abc.1) whose parent (bd-abc) doesn't exist\n     7//! 2. Dependency orphans: Issues referencing non-existent depends_on_id targets\n     8\n     9const std = @import(\"std\");\n    10const common = @import(\"common.zig\");\n    11const args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n    12\n    13const IssueStore = common.IssueStore;\n    14const CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\n    15\n    16pub const OrphansError = error{\n    17    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    18    StorageError,\n    19    OutOfMemory,\n    20};\n    21\n    22pub const OrphanInfo = struct {\n    23    id: []const u8,\n    24    orphan_type: []const u8,\n    25    missing_ref: []const u8,\n    26    title: []const u8,\n    27};\n    28\n    29pub const OrphansResult = struct {\n    30    success: bool,\n    31    orphans: ?[]const OrphanInfo = null,\n    32    count: usize = 0,\n    33    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    34};\n    35\n    36pub fn run(\n    37    cmd_args: args.OrphansArgs,\n    38    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    39    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    40) !void {\n    41    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n    42        return OrphansError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    43    };\n    44    defer ctx.deinit();\n    45\n    46    var orphans: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(OrphanInfo) = .{};\n    47    defer orphans.deinit(allocator);\n    48\n    49    // Check for hierarchical orphans (child IDs with missing parents)\n    50    if (!cmd_args.deps_only) {\n    51        try findHierarchicalOrphans(&ctx.store, allocator, &orphans);\n    52    }\n    53\n    54    // Check for dependency @import(\"std\");\n    16const storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\n    17const common = @import(\"common.zig\");\n    18const args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n    19const id_mod = 25pub const LintError = error{\n    26    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    27    StorageError,\n    28    OutOfMemory,\n    29};\n    30\n    31pub const LintIssue = struct {\n    32    id: ?[]const 39    success: bool,\n    40    issues: ?[]const LintIssue = null,\n    41    errors: usize = 0,\n    42    warnings: usize = 0,\n    43    infos: usize = 0,\n    44    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n    53        return LintError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    54    };\n    55    defer ctx.deinit();\n    56\n    57    var issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue) = .{};\n    58    defer issues.deinit(allocator);\n    59\n    60    // Run all lint checks\n    61    try lintIdFormats(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    62    try lintOrphanedHierarchy(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    63    try lintOrphanedDependencies(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    64    try lintCircularDependencies(&ctx, allocator, &issues);\n    65    try lintTitles(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    66    try lintDuplicateHashes(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    67    try lintStatusConsistency(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    68    try lintTimestamps(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    69\n    70    // Count by severity\n    71    var errors: usize = 0;\n    72    var warnings: usize = 0;\n    73    var infos: usize = 0;\n    74\n    75    for (issues.items) |issue| {\n    76        if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"error\")) {\n    77            errors += 1;\n    78        } else if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"warning\")) {\n    79            warnings += 1;\n    80        } else {\n    81            infos += 1;\n    82        }\n    83    }\n    84\n    85    // Apply limit if specified\n    86    const display_issues = if (cmd_args.limit) |limit|\n    87        issues.items[0..@min(limit, issues.items.len)]\n    88    else\n    89        issues.items;\n    90\n    91    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n    92        try ctx.output.printJson(LintResult{\n    93            .success = errors == 0,\n    94            .issues = display_issues,\n    95            .errors = errors,\n    96            .warnings = warnings,\n    97            .infos = infos,\n    98        });\n    99    } else if (!global.quiet) {\n   100        if (issues.items.len == 0) {\n   101            try ctx.output.println(\"No issues found. Database is consistent.\", .{});\n   102        } else {\n   103            try ctx.output.println(\"Database Lint Results\", .{});\n   104            try ctx.output.print(\"\\n\", .{});\n   105\n   106            for (display_issues) |issue| {\n   107                const icon = if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"error\"))\n   108                    \"[ERR]\"\n   109                else if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"warning\"))\n   110                    \"[WARN]\"\n   111                else\n   112                    \"[INFO]\";\n   113\n   114                if (issue.id) |id| {\n   115                    try ctx.output.print(\"{s} {s}: {s}\\n\", .{ icon, id, issue.message });\n   116                } else {\n   117                    try ctx.output.print(\"{s} {s}\\n\", .{ icon, issue.message });\n   118                }\n   119            }\n   120\n   121            try ctx.output.print(\"\\nSummary: {d} error(s), {d} warning(s), {d} info(s)\\n\", .{ errors, warnings, infos });\n   122\n   123            if (cmd_args.limit) |limit| {\n   124                if (issues.items.len > limit) {\n   125                    try ctx.output.print(\"(showing {d} of {d}, use --limit to see more)\\n\", .{ limit, issues.items.len });\n   126                }\n   127            }\n   128        }\n   129    }\n   130}\n   131\n   132fn lintIdFormats(\n   133 (!store.id_index.contains(parent_id)) {\n   161                try issues.append(allocator, .{\n   162                    .id = issue.id,\n   163                    .severity = \"warning\",\n   164 (!store.id_index.contains(dep.depends_on_id)) {\n   182                try issues.append(allocator, .{\n   183                    .id = issue.id,\n   184                    .severity = \"warning\",\n      }\n   190    }\n   191}\n   192\n   193fn lintCircularDependencies(\n   194    ctx: *CommandContext,\n   195    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n   196    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n   197) !void {\n   198    var graph = ctx.createGraph();\n   199    const cycles = try graph.detectCycles();\n   200    defer if (cycles) |c| allocator.free(c);\n .severity = \"error\",\n   207                .category = \"circular_dependency\",\n   208                .message = \"Circular dependencies detected in dependency graph\",\n   209            });\n }\n   237    }\n   238}\n   239\n   240fn lintDuplicateHashes(\n   241    store: *IssueStore,\n   242    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n   243    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n   244) !void {\n   245    var hash_map = std.StringHashMap([]const u8).init(allocator);\n   246    defer hash_map.deinit();\n   247\n   248    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n   249        if std.mem.Allocator,\n   269    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n   270) !void {\n   271    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n   272        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n .category = \"status_consistency\",\n   290                .message = \"Deferred issue missing defer_until date\",\n   291            });\n   292        }\n   293    }\n   294}\n   295\n   296fn Lint command for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz lint` - Validate database consistency\n//!\n//! Performs comprehensive validation checks on the issue database:\n//! - ID format validation\n//! - Orphaned hierarchical children\n//! - Orphaned dependencies\n//! - Circular dependencies\n//! - Empty or invalid titles\n//! - Duplicate content hashes\n//! - Invalid status combinations\n//! - Future timestamps\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst id_mod = @import(\"../id/mod.zig\");\nconst orphans = @import(\"orphans.zig\");\n\nconst IssueStore = common.IssueStore;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\n\npub const LintError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const LintIssue = struct {\n    id: ?[]const u8,\n    severity: []const u8, // \"error\", \"warning\", \"info\"\n    category: []const u8,\n    message: []const u8,\n};\n\npub const LintResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues: ?[]const LintIssue = null,\n    errors: usize = 0,\n    warnings: usize = 0,\n    infos: usize = 0,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    cmd_args: args.LintArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return LintError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue) = .{};\n    defer issues.deinit(allocator);\n\n    // Run all lint checks\n    try lintIdFormats(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintOrphanedHierarchy(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintOrphanedDependencies(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintCircularDependencies(&ctx, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintTitles(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintDuplicateHashes(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintStatusConsistency(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n    try lintTimestamps(&ctx.store, allocator, &issues);\n\n    // Count by severity\n    var errors: usize = 0;\n    var warnings: usize = 0;\n    var infos: usize = 0;\n\n    for (issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"error\")) {\n            errors += 1;\n        } else if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"warning\")) {\n            warnings += 1;\n        } else {\n            infos += 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Apply limit if specified\n    const display_issues = if (cmd_args.limit) |limit|\n        issues.items[0..@min(limit, issues.items.len)]\n    else\n        issues.items;\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try ctx.output.printJson(LintResult{\n            .success = errors == 0,\n            .issues = display_issues,\n            .errors = errors,\n            .warnings = warnings,\n            .infos = infos,\n        });\n    } else if (!global.quiet) {\n        if (issues.items.len == 0) {\n            try ctx.output.println(\"No issues found. Database is consistent.\", .{});\n        } else {\n            try ctx.output.println(\"Database Lint Results\", .{});\n            try ctx.output.print(\"\\n\", .{});\n\n            for (display_issues) |issue| {\n                const icon = if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"error\"))\n                    \"[ERR]\"\n                else if (std.mem.eql(u8, issue.severity, \"warning\"))\n                    \"[WARN]\"\n                else\n                    \"[INFO]\";\n\n                if (issue.id) |id| {\n                    try ctx.output.print(\"{s} {s}: {s}\\n\", .{ icon, id, issue.message });\n                } else {\n                    try ctx.output.print(\"{s} {s}\\n\", .{ icon, issue.message });\n                }\n            }\n\n            try ctx.output.print(\"\\nSummary: {d} error(s), {d} warning(s), {d} info(s)\\n\", .{ errors, warnings, infos });\n\n            if (cmd_args.limit) |limit| {\n                if (issues.items.len > limit) {\n                    try ctx.output.print(\"(showing {d} of {d}, use --limit to see more)\\n\", .{ limit, issues.items.len });\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintIdFormats(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        if (!id_mod.validateId(issue.id)) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"error\",\n                .category = \"id_format\",\n                .message = \"Invalid issue ID format\",\n            });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintOrphanedHierarchy(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        if (orphans.getParentId(issue.id)) |parent_id| {\n            if (!store.id_index.contains(parent_id)) {\n                try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                    .id = issue.id,\n                    .severity = \"warning\",\n                    .category = \"orphan_hierarchy\",\n                    .message = \"Parent issue does not exist\",\n                });\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintOrphanedDependencies(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n            if (!store.id_index.contains(dep.depends_on_id)) {\n                try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                    .id = issue.id,\n                    .severity = \"warning\",\n                    .category = \"orphan_dependency\",\n                    .message = \"Dependency references non-existent issue\",\n                });\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintCircularDependencies(\n    ctx: *CommandContext,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    var graph = ctx.createGraph();\n    const cycles = try graph.detectCycles();\n    defer if (cycles) |c| allocator.free(c);\n\n    if (cycles) |cycle_list| {\n        if (cycle_list.len > 0) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = null,\n                .severity = \"error\",\n                .category = \"circular_dependency\",\n                .message = \"Circular dependencies detected in dependency graph\",\n            });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintTitles(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        if (issue.title.len == 0) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"error\",\n                .category = \"empty_title\",\n                .message = \"Issue has empty title\",\n            });\n        } else if (issue.title.len > 500) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"warning\",\n                .category = \"long_title\",\n                .message = \"Title exceeds 500 character limit\",\n            });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintDuplicateHashes(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    var hash_map = std.StringHashMap([]const u8).init(allocator);\n    defer hash_map.deinit();\n\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        if (issue.content_hash) |hash| {\n            if (hash_map.get(hash)) |existing_id| {\n                try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                    .id = issue.id,\n                    .severity = \"info\",\n                    .category = \"duplicate_hash\",\n                    .message = try std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator, \"Duplicate content hash with {s}\", .{existing_id}),\n                });\n            } else {\n                try hash_map.put(hash, issue.id);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintStatusConsistency(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        // Closed issues should have closed_at timestamp\n        if (issue.status.eql(.closed) and issue.closed_at.value == null) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"warning\",\n                .category = \"status_consistency\",\n                .message = \"Closed issue missing closed_at timestamp\",\n            });\n        }\n\n        // Deferred issues should have defer_until\n        if (issue.status.eql(.deferred) and issue.defer_until.value == null) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"info\",\n                .category = \"status_consistency\",\n                .message = \"Deferred issue missing defer_until date\",\n            });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintTimestamps(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    const one_day_future = now + (24 * 60 * 60);\n\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        // Check for timestamps too far in the future (more than 1 day)\n        if (issue.created_at.value > one_day_future) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"warning\",\n                .category = \"future_timestamp\",\n                .message = \"created_at timestamp is in the future\",\n            });\n        }\n\n        if (issue.updated_at.value > one_day_future) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"warning\",\n                .category = \"future_timestamp\",\n                .message = \"updated_at timestamp is in the future\",\n            });\n        }\n\n        // Check that updated_at >= created_at\n        if (issue.updated_at.value < issue.created_at.value) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"warning\",\n                .category = \"timestamp_order\",\n                .message = \"updated_at is before created_at\",\n            });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"LintResult struct works\" {\n    const result = LintResult{\n        .success = true,\n        .errors = 0,\n        .warnings = 0,\n        .infos = 0,\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(result.success);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 0), result.errors);\n}\n\ntest \"LintIssue struct works\" {\n    const issue = LintIssue{\n        .id = \"bd-abc\",\n        .severity = \"error\",\n        .category = \"id_format\",\n        .message = \"Invalid ID\",\n    };\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"bd-abc\", issue.id.?);\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"error\", issue.severity);\n}\n\ntest \"run detects uninitialized workspace\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n    const cmd_args = args.LintArgs{};\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = \"/nonexistent/path\" };\n\n    const result = run(cmd_args, global, allocator);\n    try std.testing.expectError(LintError.WorkspaceNotInitialized, result);\n}\n","numLines":370,"startLine":1,"totalLines":370}}}

Changelog command for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz changelog [--since DATE] [--until DATE] [-n LIMIT] [--group-by TYPE]`\n//!\n//! Generates a changelog from closed issues, optionally filtered by date range.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = models.Status;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\nconst IssueStore = common.IssueStore;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst timestamp = models.timestamp;\n\npub const ChangelogError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    InvalidDateFormat,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const ChangelogResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    entries: ?[]const ChangelogEntry = null,\n    count: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n\n    pub const ChangelogEntry = struct {\n        id: []const u8,\n        title: []const u8,\n        issue_type: []const u8,\n        closed_at: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        close_reason: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        labels: []const []const u8 = &.{},\n    };\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    changelog_args: args.ChangelogArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var filters = IssueStore.ListFilters{};\n    filters.status = .closed;\n    filters.order_by = .updated_at;\n    filters.order_desc = true;\n\n    if (changelog_args.limit) |n| {\n        filters.limit = n;\n    }\n\n    const issues = try ctx.store.list(filters);\n    defer {\n        for (issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(issues);\n    }\n\n    // Filter by date range if specified\n    var filtered_issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer filtered_issues.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const since_ts = if (changelog_args.since) |s| parseDateToTimestamp(s) else null;\n    const until_ts = if (changelog_args.until) |u| parseDateToTimestamp(u) else null;\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const closed_ts = if (issue.closed_at.value) |t| t else continue;\n\n        if (since_ts) |since| {\n            if (closed_ts < since) continue;\n        }\n        if (until_ts) |until| {\n            if (closed_ts > until) continue;\n        }\n\n        try filtered_issues.append(allocator, issue);\n    }\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        var entries = try allocator.alloc(ChangelogResult.ChangelogEntry, filtered_issues.items.len);\n        defer allocator.free(entries);\n\n        // Track allocated timestamp strings for cleanup\n        var timestamp_strings: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n        defer {\n            for (timestamp_strings.items) |ts| {\n                allocator.free(ts);\n            }\n            timestamp_strings.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items, 0..) |issue, i| {\n            var closed_at_str: ?[]const u8 = null;\n            if (issue.closed_at.value) |ts_val| {\n                if (timestamp.formatRfc3339Alloc(allocator, ts_val)) |ts| {\n                    closed_at_str = ts;\n                    try timestamp_strings.append(allocator, ts);\n                } else |_| {}\n            }\n\n            entries[i] = .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .title = issue.title,\n                .issue_type = issue.issue_type.toString(),\n                .closed_at = closed_at_str,\n                .close_reason = issue.close_reason,\n                .labels = issue.labels,\n            };\n        }\n\n        try ctx.output.printJson(ChangelogResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .entries = entries,\n            .count = filtered_issues.items.len,\n        });\n    } else {\n        if (filtered_issues.items.len == 0) {\n            if (!global.quiet) {\n                try ctx.output.info(\"No closed issues found\", .{});\n            }\n            return;\n        }\n\n        // Group by issue type if requested\n        if (changelog_args.group_by) |group| {\n            if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(group, \"type\")) {\n                try printGroupedByType(&ctx.output, filtered_issues.items, allocator);\n                return;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Default: print as a simple changelog list\n        try ctx.output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n        try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items) |issue| {\n            const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n            const reason_suffix = if (issue.close_reason) |r| blk: {\n                var buf: [256]u8 = undefined;\n                const result = std.fmt.bufPrint(&buf, \" ({s})\", .{r}) catch \"\";\n                break :blk result;\n            } else \"\";\n\n            try ctx.output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}: {s}{s}\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                type_str,\n                issue.title,\n                reason_suffix,\n            });\n        }\n\n        if (!global.quiet) {\n            try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n            try ctx.output.info(\"{d} closed issue(s)\", .{filtered_issues.items.len});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn printGroupedByType(output: *common.Output, issues: []Issue, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    // Group issues by type\n    var type_groups: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue)) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = type_groups.valueIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |list| {\n            list.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        type_groups.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n        const result = type_groups.getOrPut(allocator, type_str) catch continue;\n        if (!result.found_existing) {\n            result.value_ptr.* = .{};\n        }\n        result.value_ptr.append(allocator, issue) catch continue;\n    }\n\n    try output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n    try output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n    // Print in a consistent order\n    const type_order = [_][]const u8{ \"feature\", \"bug\", \"task\", \"chore\", \"docs\", \"epic\", \"question\" };\n\n    for (type_order) |type_str| {\n        if (type_groups.get(type_str)) |group| {\n            if (group.items.len > 0) {\n                try output.println(\"## {s}\", .{capitalizeFirst(type_str)});\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n                for (group.items) |issue| {\n                    try output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n                }\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Print any remaining types not in the order list\n    var it = type_groups.iterator();\n    while (it.next()) |entry| {\n        var found = false;\n        for (type_order) |t| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, entry.key_ptr.*, t)) {\n                found = true;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        if (!found and entry.value_ptr.items.len > 0) {\n            try output.println(\"## {s}\", .{capitalizeFirst(entry.key_ptr.*)});\n            try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            for (entry.value_ptr.items) |issue| {\n                try output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n            }\n            try output.println(\"\", .{});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn capitalizeFirst(s: []const u8) []const u8 {\n    if (s.len == 0) return s;\n    // Return as-is for display since we can't modify const memory\n    return s;\n}\n\nfn parseDateToTimestamp(date_str: []const u8) ?i64 {\n    // Parse YYYY-MM-DD format to Unix timestamp\n    if (date_str.len < 10) return null;\n\n    const year = std.fmt.parseInt(i32, date_str[0..4], 10) catch return null;\n    const month = std.fmt.parseInt(u4, date_str[5..7], 10) catch return null;\n    const day = std.fmt.parseInt(u5, date_str[8..10], 10) catch return null;\n\n    // Simple epoch calculation (not accounting for leap seconds)\n    const epoch_day = epochDayFromDate(year, month, day);\n    return epoch_day * 86400;\n}\n\nfn epochDayFromDate(year: i32, month: u4, day: u5) i64 {\n    // Days since Unix epoch (1970-01-01)\n    var y = @as(i64, year);\n    var m = @as(i64, month);\n    const d = @as(i64, day);\n\n    // Adjust for months\n    if (m <= 2) {\n        y -= 1;\n        m += 12;\n    }\n\n    const era: i64 = @divFloor(y, 400);\n    const yoe: i64 = @mod(y, 400);\n    const doy: i64 = @divFloor(153 * (m - 3) + 2, 5) + d - 1;\n    const doe: i64 = yoe * 365 + @divFloor(yoe, 4) - @divFloor(yoe, 100) + doy;\n\n    return era * 146097 + doe - 719468;\n}\n\n// --- Tests ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized);\n}\n\ntest \"ChangelogResult struct works\" {\n    const result = ChangelogResult{\n        .success = true,\n        .count = 5,\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(result.success);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 5), result.count.?);\n}\n\ntest \"run detects uninitialized workspace\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    const changelog_args = args.ChangelogArgs{};\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = \"/nonexistent/path\" };\n\n    const result = run(changelog_args, global, allocator);\n    try std.testing.expectError(ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized, result);\n}\n\ntest \"run lists closed issues successfully\" {\n    const allocator = .{existing_id}),\n                });\n            } else {\n                try hash_map.put(hash, issue.id);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintStatusConsistency(\n    store:        });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn lintTimestamps(\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(LintIssue),\n) !void {\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    const one_day_future = now + (24 * 60 * 60);\n\n    for (store.issues.items) |issue| {\n        if (issue.status.eql(.tombstone)) continue;\n\n        // Check for timestamps too far in the future (more than 1 day)\n        if (issue.created_at.value > one_day_future) {\n            try issues.append(allocator, .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .severity = \"warning\",\n                .category = \"future_timestamp\",\n                .message = \"created_at timestamp is in the future\",\n            });\n        }\n\n        if Changelog command for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz changelog [--since DATE] [--until DATE] [-n LIMIT] [--group-by TYPE]`\n//!\n//! Generates a changelog from closed issues, optionally filtered by date range.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst IssueStore = common.IssueStore;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst timestamp = models.timestamp;\n\npub const ChangelogError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    InvalidDateFormat,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const ChangelogResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    entries: ?[]const ChangelogEntry = null,\n    count: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n\n    pub const ChangelogEntry = struct {\n        id: []const u8,\n        title: []const u8,\n        issue_type: []const u8,\n        closed_at: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        close_reason: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        labels: []const []const u8 = &.{},\n    };\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    changelog_args: args.ChangelogArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var filters = IssueStore.ListFilters{};\n    filters.status = .closed;\n    filters.order_by = .updated_at;\n    filters.order_desc = true;\n\n    if (changelog_args.limit) |n| {\n        filters.limit = n;\n    }\n\n    const issues = try ctx.store.list(filters);\n    defer {\n        for (issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(issues);\n    }\n\n    // Filter by date range if specified\n    var filtered_issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer filtered_issues.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const since_ts = if (changelog_args.since) |s| parseDateToTimestamp(s) else null;\n    const until_ts = if (changelog_args.until) |u| parseDateToTimestamp(u) else null;\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const closed_ts = if (issue.closed_at.value) |t| t else continue;\n\n        if (since_ts) |since| {\n            if (closed_ts < since) continue;\n        }\n        if (until_ts) |until| {\n            if (closed_ts > until) continue;\n        }\n\n        try filtered_issues.append(allocator, issue);\n    }\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        var entries = try allocator.alloc(ChangelogResult.ChangelogEntry, filtered_issues.items.len);\n        defer allocator.free(entries);\n\n        // Track allocated timestamp strings for cleanup\n        var timestamp_strings: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n        defer {\n            for (timestamp_strings.items) |ts| {\n                allocator.free(ts);\n            }\n            timestamp_strings.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items, 0..) |issue, i| {\n            var closed_at_str: ?[]const u8 = null;\n            if (issue.closed_at.value) |ts_val| {\n                if (timestamp.formatRfc3339Alloc(allocator, ts_val)) |ts| {\n                    closed_at_str = ts;\n                    try timestamp_strings.append(allocator, ts);\n                } else |_| {}\n            }\n\n            entries[i] = .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .title = issue.title,\n                .issue_type = issue.issue_type.toString(),\n                .closed_at = closed_at_str,\n                .close_reason = issue.close_reason,\n                .labels = issue.labels,\n            };\n        }\n\n        try ctx.output.printJson(ChangelogResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .entries = entries,\n            .count = filtered_issues.items.len,\n        });\n    } else {\n        if (filtered_issues.items.len == 0) {\n            if (!global.quiet) {\n                try ctx.output.info(\"No closed issues found\", .{});\n            }\n            return;\n        }\n\n        // Group by issue type if requested\n        if (changelog_args.group_by) |group| {\n            if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(group, \"type\")) {\n                try printGroupedByType(&ctx.output, filtered_issues.items, allocator);\n                return;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Default: print as a simple changelog list\n        try ctx.output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n        try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items) |issue| {\n            const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n            const reason_suffix = if (issue.close_reason) |r| blk: {\n                var buf: [256]u8 = undefined;\n                const result = std.fmt.bufPrint(&buf, \" ({s})\", .{r}) catch \"\";\n                break :blk result;\n            } else \"\";\n\n            try ctx.output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}: {s}{s}\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                type_str,\n                issue.title,\n                reason_suffix,\n            });\n        }\n\n        if (!global.quiet) {\n            try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n            try ctx.output.info(\"{d} closed issue(s)\", .{filtered_issues.items.len});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn printGroupedByType(output: *common.Output, issues: []Issue, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    // Group issues by type\n    var type_groups: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue)) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = type_groups.valueIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |list| {\n            list.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        type_groups.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n        const result = type_groups.getOrPut(allocator, type_str) catch continue;\n        if (!result.found_existing) {\n            result.value_ptr.* = .{};\n        }\n        result.value_ptr.append(allocator, issue) catch continue;\n    }\n\n    try output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n    try output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n    // Print in a consistent order\n    const type_order = [_][]const u8{ \"feature\", \"bug\", \"task\", \"chore\", \"docs\", \"epic\", \"question\" };\n\n    for (type_order) |type_str| {\n        if (type_groups.get(type_str)) |group| {\n            if (group.items.len > 0) {\n                try output.println(\"## {s}\", .{capitalizeFirst(type_str)});\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n                for (group.items) |issue| {\n                    try output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n                }\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Print any remaining types not in the order list\n    var it = type_groups.iterator();\n    while (it.next()) |entry| {\n        var found = false;\n        for (type_order) |t| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, entry.key_ptr.*, t)) {\n                found = true;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        if (!found and entry.value_ptr.items.len > 0) {\n            try output.println(\"## {s}\", .{capitalizeFirst(entry.key_ptr.*)});\n            try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            for (entry.value_ptr.items) |issue| {\n                try output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n            }\n            try output.println(\"\", .{});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn capitalizeFirst(s: []const u8) []const u8 {\n    if (s.len == 0) return s;\n    // Return as-is for display since we can't modify const memory\n    return s;\n}\n\nfn parseDateToTimestamp(date_str: []const u8) ?i64 {\n    // Parse YYYY-MM-DD format to Unix timestamp\n    if (date_str.len < 10) return null;\n\n    const year = std.fmt.parseInt(i32, date_str[0..4], 10) catch return null;\n    const month = std.fmt.parseInt(u4, date_str[5..7], 10) catch return null;\n    const day = std.fmt.parseInt(u5, date_str[8..10], 10) catch return null;\n\n    // Simple epoch calculation (not accounting for leap seconds)\n    const epoch_day = epochDayFromDate(year, month, day);\n    return epoch_day * 86400;\n}\n\nfn epochDayFromDate(year: i32, month: u4, day: u5) i64 {\n    // Days since Unix epoch (1970-01-01)\n    var y = @as(i64, year);\n    var m = @as(i64, month);\n    const d = @as(i64, day);\n\n    // Adjust for months\n    if (m <= 2) {\n        y -= 1;\n        m += 12;\n    }\n\n    const era: i64 = @divFloor(y, 400);\n    const yoe: i64 = @mod(y, 400);\n    const doy: i64 = @divFloor(153 * (m - 3) + 2, 5) + d - 1;\n    const doe: i64 = yoe * 365 + @divFloor(yoe, 4) - @divFloor(yoe, 100) + doy;\n\n    return era * 146097 + doe - 719468;\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"ChangelogError enum exists\" {\n    const err: ChangelogError = ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    try std.testing.expect(err == (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var filters = IssueStore.ListFilters{};\n    filters.status = .closed;\n    filters.order_by = .updated_at;\n    filters.order_desc = true;\n\n    if (changelog_args.limit) |n| {\n        filters.limit = n;\n    }\n\n    const issues = try ctx.store.list(filters);\n    defer {\n        for (issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(issues);\n    }\n\n    // Filter by date range if specified\n    var filtered_issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer filtered_issues.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const since_ts = if (changelog_args.since) |s| parseDateToTimestamp(s) else null;\n    const until_ts = if (changelog_args.until) |u| parseDateToTimestamp(u) else null;\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const closed_ts = if (issue.closed_at.value) |t| t else continue;\n\n        if (since_ts) |since| {\n            if (closed_ts < since) continue;\n        }\n        if (until_ts) |until| {\n            if (closed_ts > until) continue;\n        }\n\n        try filtered_issues.append(allocator, issue);\n    }\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        var entries = try allocator.alloc(ChangelogResult.ChangelogEntry, filtered_issues.items.len);\n        defer allocator.free(entries);\n\n        // Track allocated timestamp strings for cleanup\n        var timestamp_strings: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n        defer {\n            for (timestamp_strings.items) |ts| {\n                allocator.free(ts);\n            }\n            timestamp_strings.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items, 0..) |issue, i| {\n            var closed_at_str: ?[]const u8 = null;\n            if (issue.closed_at.value) issue.issue_type.toString(),\n                .closed_at = closed_at_str,\n                .close_reason = issue.close_reason,\n                .labels = issue.labels,\n            };\n        }\n\n        try ctx.output.printJson(ChangelogResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .entries = entries,\n            .count = filtered_issues.items.len,\n        });\n    } else {\n        if (filtered_issues.items.len == 0) {\n            if (!global.quiet) {\n                try ctx.output.info(\"No closed issues found\", .{});\n            }\n            return;\n        }\n\n        // result;\n            } else \"\";\n\n            try ctx.output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}: {s}{s}\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                type_str,\n                issue.title,\n                reason_suffix,\n            });\n        }\n\n        if (!global.quiet) {\n            try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n            try ctx.output.info(\"{d} closed issue(s)\", .{filtered_issues.items.len});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn printGroupedByType(output: *common.Output, issues: []Issue, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    // Group issues by type\n    var type_groups: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue)) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = type_groups.valueIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |list| {\n            list.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        type_groups.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n        const result = catch continue;\n    }\n\n    try output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n    try output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n    // Print in a consistent order\n    const type_order = [_][]const u8{ \"feature\", \"bug\", \"task\", \"chore\", \"docs\", \"epic\", \"question\" };\n\n    for (type_order) |type_str| {\n        if (type_groups.get(type_str)) |group| {\n            if (group.items.len > 0) {\n {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n                }\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Print any remaining types not in the order list\n    var it = type_groups.iterator();\n    while (it.next()) |entry| {\n        var found = false;\n        for (type_order) |t| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, entry.key_ptr.*, t)) {\n Changelog command for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz changelog [--since DATE] [--until DATE] [-n LIMIT] [--group-by TYPE]`\n//!\n//! Generates a changelog from closed issues, optionally filtered by date range.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst IssueStore = common.IssueStore;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst timestamp = models.timestamp;\n\npub const ChangelogError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    InvalidDateFormat,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const ChangelogResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    entries: ?[]const ChangelogEntry = null,\n    count: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n\n    pub const ChangelogEntry = struct {\n        id: []const u8,\n        title: []const u8,\n        issue_type: []const u8,\n        closed_at: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        close_reason: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        labels: []const []const u8 = &.{},\n    };\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    changelog_args: args.ChangelogArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var filters = IssueStore.ListFilters{};\n    filters.status = .closed;\n    filters.order_by = .updated_at;\n    filters.order_desc = true;\n\n    if (changelog_args.limit) |n| {\n        filters.limit = n;\n    }\n\n    const issues = try ctx.store.list(filters);\n    defer {\n        for (issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(issues);\n    }\n\n    // Filter by date range if specified\n    var filtered_issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer filtered_issues.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const since_ts = if (changelog_args.since) |s| parseDateToTimestamp(s) else null;\n    const until_ts = if (changelog_args.until) |u| parseDateToTimestamp(u) else null;\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const closed_ts = if (issue.closed_at.value) |t| t else continue;\n\n        if (since_ts) |since| {\n            if (closed_ts < since) continue;\n        }\n        if (until_ts) |until| {\n            if (closed_ts > until) continue;\n        }\n\n        try filtered_issues.append(allocator, issue);\n    }\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        var entries = try allocator.alloc(ChangelogResult.ChangelogEntry, filtered_issues.items.len);\n        defer allocator.free(entries);\n\n        // Track allocated timestamp strings for cleanup\n        var timestamp_strings: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n        defer {\n            for (timestamp_strings.items) |ts| {\n                allocator.free(ts);\n            }\n            timestamp_strings.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items, 0..) |issue, i| {\n            var closed_at_str: ?[]const u8 = null;\n            if (issue.closed_at.value) |ts_val| {\n                if (timestamp.formatRfc3339Alloc(allocator, ts_val)) |ts| {\n                    closed_at_str = ts;\n                    try timestamp_strings.append(allocator, ts);\n                } else |_| {}\n            }\n\n            entries[i] = .{\n                .id = issue.id,\n                .title = issue.title,\n                .issue_type = issue.issue_type.toString(),\n                .closed_at = closed_at_str,\n                .close_reason = issue.close_reason,\n                .labels = issue.labels,\n            };\n        }\n\n        try ctx.output.printJson(ChangelogResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .entries = entries,\n            .count = filtered_issues.items.len,\n        });\n    } else {\n        if (filtered_issues.items.len == 0) {\n            if (!global.quiet) {\n                try ctx.output.info(\"No closed issues found\", .{});\n            }\n            return;\n        }\n\n        // Group by issue type if requested\n        if (changelog_args.group_by) |group| {\n            if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(group, \"type\")) {\n                try printGroupedByType(&ctx.output, filtered_issues.items, allocator);\n                return;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Default: print as a simple changelog list\n        try ctx.output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n        try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n        for (filtered_issues.items) |issue| {\n            const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n            const reason_suffix = if (issue.close_reason) |r| blk: {\n                var buf: [256]u8 = undefined;\n                const result = std.fmt.bufPrint(&buf, \" ({s})\", .{r}) catch \"\";\n                break :blk result;\n            } else \"\";\n\n            try ctx.output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}: {s}{s}\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                type_str,\n                issue.title,\n                reason_suffix,\n            });\n        }\n\n        if (!global.quiet) {\n            try ctx.output.println(\"\", .{});\n            try ctx.output.info(\"{d} closed issue(s)\", .{filtered_issues.items.len});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn printGroupedByType(output: *common.Output, issues: []Issue, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    // Group issues by type\n    var type_groups: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue)) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = type_groups.valueIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |list| {\n            list.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        type_groups.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        const type_str = issue.issue_type.toString();\n        const result = type_groups.getOrPut(allocator, type_str) catch continue;\n        if (!result.found_existing) {\n            result.value_ptr.* = .{};\n        }\n        result.value_ptr.append(allocator, issue) catch continue;\n    }\n\n    try output.println(\"# Changelog\", .{});\n    try output.println(\"\", .{});\n\n    // Print in a consistent order\n    const type_order = [_][]const u8{ \"feature\", \"bug\", \"task\", \"chore\", \"docs\", \"epic\", \"question\" };\n\n    for (type_order) |type_str| {\n        if (type_groups.get(type_str)) |group| {\n            if (group.items.len > 0) {\n                try output.println(\"## {s}\", .{type_str});\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n                for (group.items) |issue| {\n                    try output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n                }\n                try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Print any remaining types not in the order list\n    var it = type_groups.iterator();\n    while (it.next()) |entry| {\n        var found = false;\n        for (type_order) |t| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, entry.key_ptr.*, t)) {\n                found = true;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        if (!found and entry.value_ptr.items.len > 0) {\n            try output.println(\"## {s}\", .{entry.key_ptr.*});\n            try output.println(\"\", .{});\n            for (entry.value_ptr.items) |issue| {\n                try output.println(\"- [{s}] {s}\", .{ issue.id, issue.title });\n            }\n            try output.println(\"\", .{});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn capitalizeFirst(s: []const u8) []const u8 {\n    if (s.len == 0) return s;\n    // Return as-is for display since we can't modify const memory\n    return s;\n}\n\nfn parseDateToTimestamp(date_str: []const u8) ?i64 {\n    // Parse YYYY-MM-DD format to Unix timestamp\n    if (date_str.len < 10) return null;\n\n    const year = std.fmt.parseInt(i32, date_str[0..4], 10) catch return null;\n    const month = std.fmt.parseInt(u4, date_str[5..7], 10) catch return null;\n    const day = std.fmt.parseInt(u5, date_str[8..10], 10) catch return null;\n\n    // Simple epoch calculation (not accounting for leap seconds)\n    const epoch_day = epochDayFromDate(year, month, day);\n    return epoch_day * 86400;\n}\n\nfn epochDayFromDate(year: i32, month: u4, day: u5) i64 {\n    // Days since Unix epoch (1970-01-01)\n    var y = @as(i64, year);\n    var m = @as(i64, month);\n    const d = @as(i64, day);\n\n    // Adjust for months\n    if (m <= 2) {\n        y -= 1;\n        m += 12;\n    }\n\n    const era: i64 = @divFloor(y, 400);\n    const yoe: i64 = @mod(y, 400);\n    const doy: i64 = @divFloor(153 * (m - 3) + 2, 5) + d - 1;\n    const doe: i64 = yoe * 365 + @divFloor(yoe, 4) - @divFloor(yoe, 100) + doy;\n\n    return era * 146097 + doe - 719468;\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"ChangelogError enum exists\" {\n    const err: ChangelogError = ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    try std.testing.expect(err == ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized);\n}\n\ntest \"ChangelogResult struct works\" {\n    const result = ChangelogResult{\n        .success = true,\n        .count = 5,\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(result.success);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 5), result.count.?);\n}\n\ntest \"run detects uninitialized workspace\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    const changelog_args = args.ChangelogArgs{};\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = \"/nonexistent/path\" };\n\n    const result = run(changelog_args, global, allocator);\n    try std.testing.expectError(ChangelogError.WorkspaceNotInitialized, result);\n}\n\ntest \"run lists closed issues successfully\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    const tmp_dir_path = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"changelog_test\");\n    defer allocator.free(tmp_dir_path);\n    defer test_util.cleanupTestDir(tmp_dir_path);\n\n    const data_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ tmp_dir_path, \".beads\" });\n    defer allocator.free(data_path);\n\n    try std.fs.cwd().makeDir(data_path);\n\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ data_path, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    const f = try std.fs.cwd().createFile(issues_path, .{});\n    defer f.close();\n\n    const changelog_args = args.ChangelogArgs{};\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = data_path };\n\n    try run(changelog_args, global, allocator);\n}\n\ntest \"parseDateToTimestamp parses valid date\" {\n    const ts = parseDateToTimestamp(\"2024-01-15\");\n    try std.testing.expect(ts != null);\n    // 2024-01-15 should be around 1705276800 (depends on invalid date\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(?i64, null), parseDateToTimestamp(\"invalid\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(?i64, null), parseDateToTimestamp(\"2024\"));\n    try created_at | string | yes | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| created_by | string | no | Creator |\n| updated_at | string | yes | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| closed_at | string | no | RFC3339 timestamp when closed |\n| close_reason | string | no | Reason for closing |\n| due_at | string | no | RFC3339 due date |\n| defer_until | string | no | RFC3339 defer date |\n| estimated_minutes | number | no | Time estimate |\n| external_ref | string | no | External tracker link |\n| source_system | string | no | Import source |\n| pinned | boolean | yes | High-priority display flag |\n| is_template | boolean | yes | Template flag |\n| labels | array | yes | String array of labels |\n| dependencies | array | yes | Array of Dependency objects |\n| comments | array | yes | Array of Comment objects |\n\n## WAL Entry (beads.wal)\n\nWrite-ahead log for concurrent writes.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| op | string | add, update, close, reopen, delete, set_blocked, unset_blocked |\n| ts | number | Unix timestamp for ordering |\n| id | string | Issue ID |\n| data | object | Full Issue object (for add/update) or null |\n\n## Dependency\n\nEmbedded in Issue.dependencies array.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| issue_id | string | Dependent issue |\n| depends_on_id | string | Blocker issue |\n| dep_type | string | blocks, parent_child, waits_for, related, etc. |\n| created_at | string | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| created_by | string | Creator |\n| metadata | string | JSON blob for extra data |\n| thread_id | string | Optional thread reference |\n\n## Comment\n\nEmbedded in Issue.comments array.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| id | number
